alert.note: Alert for Cheshire; Merrimack; Sullivan; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 14 at 3:20AM EDT until March 15 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT WINTER STORM TODAY INTO WEDNESDAY... .Rapidly strengthening low pressure approaches southern New England this morning, and remains in the Gulf of Maine into tomorrow. Snow continues overspreading the area during the morning hours today. Greatest snowfall will likely fall at higher terrain across the Monadnocks, Sunapee, the Ossippees, and White Mountains. At lower elevations, heavy and wet snow is expected, likely causing scattered power outages today and tonight. Gusty northeast to north winds of 40 to 55 mph this afternoon and evening could accentuate the power outage risk this afternoon. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 9 and 19 inches for a storm total of 12 to 24 inches, with locally greater than 24 inches possible across the higher terrain. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Western and Central Hillsborough, Merrimack, Sullivan, and Cheshire Counties. * WHEN...Until 8 AM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Significant snowfall and periods of heavy snowfall rates will combine to create low visibility and very dangerous driving conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commutes today. The strong winds and weight of snow on tree limbs may down power lines and will likely cause power outages.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org Persons should consider delaying all travel. Motorists should use extreme caution if travel is absolutely necessary.
